The JM distance measures the inter-class separability, indicating how well the selected characteristic wavelengths can distinguish between different disease levels of rice blast. The within-class scatter measures the intra-class aggregation, indicating how well the selected characteristic wavelengths can group together samples within the same disease level.

This DCNN structure was trained to learn different classes of disease features.

Additionally, the guided gradient-weighted class activation mapping (Guided-GradCAM) method was employed to obtain the guided grade-weighted heatmap (Guided-GradHM) of the last layer of convolution. instruction: How does the Guided-GradCAM method based on the ResNet-CBAM network structure compare to traditional methods in terms of accurately selecting spectral characteristic wavelengths for different disease levels of rice blast?
Output:
The Guided-GradCAM method based on the ResNet-CBAM network structure outperforms traditional methods in accurately selecting spectral characteristic wavelengths for different disease levels of rice blast. The results of the related study show that the characteristic wavelengths selected by the Guided-GradCAM method have good inter-class separability and intra-class aggregation. The JM distance, which measures the separability between different classes, is greater than 1.9, indicating a high degree of distinction between disease levels. Additionally, the within-class scatter, which measures the compactness within each class, is less than 0.4, indicating that the selected wavelengths effectively capture the common features within each disease level.

Furthermore, the spectral characteristic wavelengths selected by the Guided-GradCAM method were used to construct random forest (RF) and support vector machine (SVM) models for disease level classification. These models achieved the best accuracy in classifying the disease levels, with an overall accuracy (OA) of 97.21% and Kappa values ranging from 96.51% to 96.55%. This indicates that the selected wavelengths effectively capture the distinguishing features of different disease levels, enabling accurate identification and classification.
